H0.text: Learned behavior is demonstrated when a dog rolls over, receives a treat, and then rolls over again.

H1.text: Adaptive behavior is demonstrated when a dog rolls over, receives a treat, and then rolls over again.

H2.text: Inherited behavior is demonstrated when a dog rolls over to receive a treat and then rolls over again.

H3.text: Instinctive behavior is the example of a dog rolling over, receiving a treat, and then rolling over again.

A4.text: Consequences consist of rewards or punishments.

A5.text: Complexity in the behavior of an organism may be correlated to the complexity of its nervous system. Generally, organisms with more complex nervous systems have a greater capacity to learn new responses and thus adjust their behavior.
